meanings.definition: The style of art characterized by extremely realistic depictions.
meanings.sent1: Her paintings showcase the hyperrealisms of everyday objects, making them look almost like photographs.
meanings.sent2: The hyperrealisms in his sculptures were so detailed that they appeared lifelike.
meanings.sent3: The hyperrealisms in the portrait were so accurate that it seemed as if the subject would step out of the canvas.
meanings.sent4: The hyperrealisms in his artwork were so precise that they blurred the line between reality and illusion.
meanings.sent5: The hyperrealisms in the landscape painting brought the scene to life with incredible detail.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being hyperrealistic.
meanings.sent1: The hyperrealisms of the film's special effects made the action sequences feel incredibly real.
meanings.sent2: Artists strive for hyperrealisms in their work to create a sense of authenticity.
meanings.sent3: The hyperrealisms of the virtual reality game made it hard to distinguish between the game world and reality.
meanings.sent4: His attention to hyperrealisms in his writing made the characters jump off the page.
meanings.sent5: The hyperrealisms of the actor's performance brought the character to life in a truly convincing way.
